channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Science of D-Day
channel.desc: Engineer Rob Bell explores the new inventions - from giant troop-carrying gliders to tanks that could operate on water - that made the Normandy invasion in 1944 possible.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Talking Pictures
channel.desc: Celia Imrie tells the story of Kirk Douglas's 1960 epic Spartacus and reveals how what was then the most expensive film of all time made it onto the big screen.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Spartacus
channel.desc: 76 BC. Born into slavery, the gladiator Spartacus longs for freedom and soon finds himself at the head of an army of slaves in revolt against the might of the Roman Empire.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Pride and Prejudice
channel.desc: Rejected by Elizabeth, Darcy returns to Rosings Park and writes to her, revealing the truth about Wickham.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Pride and Prejudice
channel.desc: Dramatisation of Jane Austen's classic story. Darcy is pleased to introduce Elizabeth to his sister, Georgiana, and to welcome her, and her aunt and uncle, to Pemberley.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Pride and Prejudice
channel.desc: A dramatisation of Jane Austen's classic story. There is great excitement in the neighbourhood when Bingley returns to Netherfield, bringing Darcy with him.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Science of D-Day
channel.desc: Engineer Rob Bell explores the new inventions - from giant troop-carrying gliders to tanks that could operate on water - that made the Normandy invasion in 1944 possible.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: D-Day 80
channel.desc: Eighty years on, Rachel Burden traces the stories of the UK's D-Day veterans in Normandy and hears their memories of the massive beach invasion and the battles that followed.

channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Gary Davies presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 5 June 1987, and featuring Erasure, U2, Pepsi & Shirlie, Suzanne Vega, Wet Wet Wet and Whitney Houston.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Richard Skinner introduces Siouxsie & The Banshees, Kate Robbins & Beyond, Imagination, Phil Collins, Shakin' Stevens, Squeeze, The Jam, Toyah and Adam & The Ants.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Athletics
channel.desc: World-class athletics from the Eternal City as a plethora of household names in track and field compete at the Stadio Olimpico in the fifth Diamond League meet of the season.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: John Peel and Janice Long present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 7 March 1985 and featuring Shakin' Stevens, Madonna, Jermaine Jackson and Dead or Alive.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Mike Read and Gary Davies present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 25 April 1985 and featuring Bronski Beat & Marc Almond, The Rah Band, David Grant & Jaki Graham and USA for Africa.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Lionel Richie
channel.desc: How singer-songwriter Lionel Richie achieved a dream of becoming 'as big as The Beatles'.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Prince and His Songs at the BBC
channel.desc: A collection of hits from one of pop music's greatest geniuses - Prince, aka 'The Artist Formerly Known as Prince', aka 'the Unpronounceable Symbol', and more.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The 80s - Music's Greatest Decade?
channel.desc: Dylan Jones opens up the archive to select some of the most significant alternative voices in 1980s music.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Flying Gardener
channel.desc: Chris Beardshaw travels around by helicopter to find Britain's most inspirational gardens. In the Lake District, Chris goes in search of the ultimate water feature.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: James battles through snowy dales to save a litter of piglets and Tristan hopes Siegfried will give him a job.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: With Helen still bedridden, James struggles manfully with both chores and children as Siegfried and Tristan look on idly.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Black Forest Murders
channel.desc: Relentless detective work links the death of Berghoff to an unsolved murder in Austria. Deals with adult themes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Black Forest Murders
channel.desc: As Kramer is told to downsize the team, they finally get a solid lead. Deals with adult themes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Bob Servant
channel.desc: Sitcom originating from the Bob Servant books. Bob and Frank start a new chapter in their lives, and things go well until a woman comes between them. Contains some strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Bob Servant
channel.desc: Sitcom originating from the Bob Servant books. Bob defends himself in court after a fracas with Hendo, but can he convince the jury of his innocence? Contains adult humour.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Bob Servant
channel.desc: Bob reacts badly when he learns that Frank has plans to marry and leave Broughty Ferry. Contains adult humour.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Seventies sitcom about a self-sufficient couple in suburbia. Tom finds marketing his garden produce more difficult than he thought, especially when the rates are due.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes Minister
channel.desc: Sitcom about a British government minister and the advisers who surround him. Jim Hacker MP and Sir Humphrey learn of a plan that threatens them both.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Cricket
channel.desc: All the key moments from Bristol, where England take on the West Indies for the second T20 game of a three-match series.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Vienna Philharmonic
channel.desc: Sir Bryn Terfel, Juan Diego Florez and Yuja Wang are among guests in a star-studded gala featuring the music of Bizet and Ravel to mark the 150th anniversary of Palais Garnier.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Many Faces of Alison Steadman
channel.desc: Documentary in which actress Alison Steadman talks about her career, from her earliest appearances on screen. Featuring archive footage and testimony from friends and colleagues.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Alison Steadman Remembers... Girl
channel.desc: Alison Steadman tells the story of groundbreaking 1974 TV drama Girl. Once thought lost forever, the film later resurfaced, giving Alison the opportunity to share her memories.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Second City Firsts
channel.desc: 1970s drama. Just as she is about to leave the army, Jackie has an encounter with an old lover. Stars Alison Steadman in an early TV role. Contains language which some may find offensive.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Gateways Grind
channel.desc: Sandi Toksvig goes behind the iconic green door of one of the most famous lesbian venues in the world, The Gateways Club.
